Nimy Resources – ASX Announcement Summary

(5 August 2025)

Material Information:
- Strategic Partnership: Engaged NYSE-listed M2i Global to secure U.S. government funding (non-dilutive grants, loans, offtake) via EXIM Bank, DoD, and DoE programs.
- Performance Rights Grants:
- 2.4M shares vesting on EXIM Bank LOI acceptance.
- 4.8M shares vesting on binding EXIM term sheet.
- Fees: $10K/month retainer (~3 months) for EXIM application support.
- Term: Initial 6-month non-exclusive engagement.

Rationale for Materiality:
- Potential for significant non-dilutive U.S. funding (liquidity/capital structure impact).
- Performance rights dilute existing shareholders (up to 7.2M new shares).

No material operational/financial data (e.g., cash balance, drilling results) disclosed.

(Tailored as "Other Announcement Type"—focusing on strategic funding and dilution risk.)

- No other material interests or securities disclosed.

No material trading or capital markets impact identified.

• Substantial Holder Change: Ben Dingle and associated entities' voting power in Nuchev Limited decreased from 25.87% to 24.33% due to dilution from share issuance (EIP Performance Rights and H&S Options exercises).
  • No Material Changes: No actual shares were acquired or disposed; dilution resulted from increased outstanding shares.
  • Relevant Interests: 37,853,680 ordinary shares held by 402339 Pty Ltd (Whiti Trust) remain unchanged.

No other material trading or capital markets information identified.

• Project Agreement with Ear Science Institute Australia (ESIA):
  • ESIA to contribute $100,000 in funding + expertise for bone conduction hearing solutions.
  • Focus: Product evaluation, stakeholder engagement, and pilot integration in classrooms.
  • Commercial potential highlighted in underserved markets; project starts this month.

No material financial, trading, or capital structure impact identified; primarily an R&D collaboration update.

• Key Drill Results (Odienné Gold Project):
  • 21m @ 1.21g/t Au (incl. 6m @ 3.17g/t Au) – ODRC004
  • 9m @ 1.24g/t Au – ODRC023

  • 12m @ 0.75g/t Au (incl. 3m @ 1.45g/t Au) – ODRC030

  • Exploration Progress:

  • Odienné: Confirmed gold mineralization over >18km strike; IP ground geophysics planned for Q4 2025.

  • Ferké: 6,673m RC drilling completed (assays pending); diamond drilling expanded to >15,000m (from 8,000m).

  • Strategic Context: Odienné is on trend with major deposits (e.g., Robex’s 3.7Moz Kiniero).

No material capital, liquidity, or valuation impacts identified.

Material Information Summary:

  • Key Drilling Results at Nyungu Central Deposit:
  • NCDD010: 60.5m @ 0.53% Cu (sulphide), including 33.0m @ 0.71% Cu. Oxide zone: 31.0m @ 0.42% Cu.
  • NCDD009: 18.0m @ 0.59% Cu, including 6.3m @ 1.11% Cu.

  • Extends mineralisation into oxide (south) and sulphide (north) domains.

  • Exploration Progress:

  • Phase 2 drilling ongoing with 3 diamond rigs (Nyungu ‘Corridor’ and Kabikupa).
  • Airborne EM survey completed; interpretation underway.

  • Regional aircore drilling to commence in early August (targeting West Mwombezhi/Nyungu North).

  • Assays Pending:

  • Kabikupa deposit (potential second discovery). 8 holes at Nyungu Central (2,483.4m) pending.

  • Metallurgical Testwork:

  • Positive results for Nyungu Central sulphides (25–32% Cu concentrate grade, 81–96% recoveries).

  • Mineral Resource Context:

  • Mumbezhi’s current JORC Resource: 107.2Mt @ 0.5% Cu (514.6kt contained copper).

No capital raising, trading halt, or liquidity-impacting events identified.

Note: Omitted routine operational updates (e.g., soil sampling progress) per guidelines.

Material Information Summary: Exploration Results (High-Grade Silver & Gold Intersections)

  • Key Assay Highlights:
  • Silver (Ag):
    • 6m @ 4,747 g/t Ag (from 46m) – ranked 5th highest-grade silver intersection globally in H1 2025.
    • 1m @ 17,600 g/t Ag (from 46m, TBAC130).
    • 1m @ 2,240 g/t Ag & 22.8 g/t Au (from 53m, TBM246).

  • Gold (Au):

    • 4m @ 13.2 g/t Au (from 48m, TBAC130), including 1m @ 51.2 g/t Au.
    • 11m @ 3.31 g/t Au (from 48m, TBM246), including 1m @ 22.8 g/t Au.

  • Exploration Progress:

  • Diamond drilling to commence soon to investigate structural controls and mineralization origin.

  • Soil sampling program completed (~430 samples); results expected September 2025.

  • Mineralization Context:

  • Expanded footprint (1.5km wide) with multiple high-grade Au-Ag horizons ("upper" and "lower" zones).
  • Broad, shallow mineralization in oxide/transitional zones.

Summary:

Significant high-grade silver and gold intercepts confirm Tolmer’s potential, with exploration ongoing. Results may impact resource estimates and project valuation.

Methodology Note: Reported intervals use >60 g/t Ag or >0.5 g/t Au cutoffs; true widths unknown.

No capital markets actions (e.g., raising, timetable) or trading halt triggers identified.

Vitrafy Life Sciences Limited (ASX: VFY) – Financial Results Presentation FY25 (5 August 2025)

Material Information Summary

Operational Highlights

  • Technology Development:
  • VCU2 hardware detailed design completed; build phase commenced.
  • Unregulated market product launch on track for Q2 FY26; regulated (medical device) launch expected H2 FY26 (USA).

  • LifeChain software upgrade progressing, with first release aligned to VCU2.

  • Commercial Progress:

  • Blood Platelets:
    • Phase 1 study with U.S. Military (USAISR) completed, exceeding industry standards. Phase 2 to commence Q1 FY26.
  • Cell & Gene Therapies:
    • PBMC validation data shows 96% viability (vs. industry standard ≥70%). Engaging with potential partners.
  • Aquaculture:
    • Paid pilots with domestic providers; fertilisation results outperforming competitors (Vitrafy: 70.2% vs. competitor: 49.4%).
  • Bovine:
    • Post-thaw semen motility exceeding industry standards; collaboration with Select Sires, Inc. ongoing.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $65k (up 75% YoY), driven by aquaculture and grants.
  • Grant Income: $4.8m Australian Industry Growth Fund grant awarded ($2.4m received, remainder deferred).
  • R&D Tax Incentive: $983k (down from $2.0m YoY due to reduced eligibility).
  • Cash Position: $29.6m (including $10.1m term deposits). Forecast runway through CY2027.
  • Loss: Reported loss of $32.7m, but normalised loss at $11.3m after excluding non-cash items (e.g., $18.9m convertible note conversion cost).

FY26 Outlook

  • Market Development: Focus on revenue-generating activities in animal reproduction, human health collaborations, and U.S. expansion.
  • Technology Milestones:
  • Unregulated product launch (H1 FY26); medical device launch (H2 FY26).
  • Scale manufacturing and supply chain capacity.

Key Risks/Monitors

  • Execution risk on VCU2 and LifeChain timelines.
  • Regulatory approvals for medical device (U.S. H2 FY26).
  • R&D spend to increase ~50% in FY26 (front-loaded in 1H).

No material capital raising, trading halt, or corporate action details identified.

Here’s the concise extraction of material information from the TPG Telecom ASX announcement, tailored for capital markets decisions:

Capital Management Plan Summary
- Capital Reduction: Pro rata return of up to $3 billion (~$1.61/share), subject to shareholder approval at EGM (planned October 2025).
- Reinvestment Plan: Up to $688 million in new shares for minorities; if fully subscribed, free float increases to ~30% (currently 23%).
- Debt Repayment: Targeting $2.4 billion reduction (to ~$1.7bn drawn debt); pro forma leverage at 1.3x EBITDA (pre-AASB16).
- Dividend Policy: 18 cps targeted for FY25 (flat YoY), with growth tied to future cash flow/profits.

Key Dates
- 1H25 Results: 28 Aug 2025.
- EGM/Record Date: October 2025 (exact TBC).
- Distribution/Issuance: Late October 2025 (post EGM).

Operational Highlights (Pro Forma 1H25)
- EBITDA: $786m (+0.9% YoY) on revenue of $2.45bn (+2.0% YoY).
- Mobile Subscribers: +100k (postpaid port-ins +48% YoY).
- FY25 Guidance: EBITDA $1.605–1.655bn; capex ~$790m (incl. LEOsat investment).

Liquidity Impact
- Post-Vocus sale: $4.7bn net proceeds (closing cash balance not stated).
- Free cash flow rebound expected post-peak capex (FY27 target: $550–650m).

Notes:
- Tax ruling sought for Capital Reduction treatment.
- Material Risk: Plan hinges on EGM approval and market conditions.
- Omitted: Non-IFRS metrics, historical data, and regulatory disclaimers. No material info missing.

Actionable: Watch EGM outcome (October) and 1H25 results (28 Aug) for confirmation of capital return timelines.

Segment Performance & Outlook

  • US Debt Buying:
  • FY26 investment guidance: $200–230m (70% already contracted).
  • Focus on shorter-duration credit card receivables.
  • AU/NZ Lending:
  • Wizit digital credit card rollout (pilot book: $45m, target: $100–200m medium-term).
  • Plans to resume auto lending growth and expand into UK sub-prime market (H1 FY26).
  • AU/NZ Debt Buying:
  • Stabilized sale volumes, but competition from private credit.

FY26 Guidance

  • Ledger Investment: $280–330m
  • Gross Lending: $350–390m
  • NPAT: $100–110m (+12% at midpoint)
  • EPS: 147–162c

Capital Position

  • Excess capital: $150m available for growth.

Capital Raising Announcement Summary:
- Capital Return: Up to $3 billion pro rata capital reduction (~$1.61/share).
- Reinvestment Plan: Up to $688 million raised from minority shareholders to increase free float (23% → 30%) and repay debt.
- Debt Repayment: Total $2.4 billion (incl. Reinvestment proceeds), targeting $1.7bn residual debt (~1.3x FY25 EBITDA).
- Dividend: FY25 target 18c/share (flat vs. FY24), with policy to grow payout over time.
- Key Dates: EGM for approval in early October 2025; Reinvestment Plan settles late October.

Material Financial Impact:
- Post-transaction net leverage at investment-grade level.
- Strategic shareholders (77% combined) support all initiatives; no participation in Reinvestment Plan to boost free float liquidity.

Note: Subject to shareholder/regulatory approvals. Reinvestment Plan pricing & final terms TBD.

  • Cash Position & Liquidity:

  • Debt: Fully repaid; zero outstanding.

  • Hedging: 12,000oz put options @ A$3,500/oz; 6,000oz calls @ A$4,200/oz (expiring end-2025).

  • FY2025 Operational Performance:

  • Production: Unspecified volume, but AISC of A$1,991/oz.
  • EBITDA: A$196.4M (FY25).

  • Processing: 1.2Mtpa plant operating at 95.8% recovery.

  • FY2026 Guidance:

  • Production: 100,000–110,000oz gold.
  • AISC: A$1,950–A$2,250/oz.
  • Exploration budget: A$55M (focus: Scotia, OK mines, Mainfield).

  • Growth capex: A$67M (regional exploration ramp-up).

  • Key Growth Projects:

  • OK Underground: Steady-state production (~40,000ozpa); grade 5.83g/t (FY25).
  • Scotia Underground: Ramping to ~60,000ozpa; high-grade extensions identified.
  • Mainfield: High-grade drilling results (e.g., 5.7m @ 35.85g/t); Bullen decline rehabilitation underway (potential 40,000oz from 130kt @ 9.5g/t).

  • Open Pits: Princess Royal operational (20,000oz @ 2.1g/t in 2025); Gladstone pit to start 2026.

  • Resource Base:

  • Total M&I Resources: 44.9Mt @ 3.3g/t (4.7Moz Au) (per 26 Sep 2024 statement; no material changes).

  • Market Position:

  • Market Cap: A$1.4B (share price A$3.66 as of 31 July 2025).
  • Major Shareholders: Tulla (12.7%), Regal FM (12.3%), Sprott (7.2%).

Key Catalyst:
- Mainfield development (potential to double production to +200kozpa medium-term).

No capital raising, trading halt, or other material corporate actions announced.
